thread.title: Ciaranfagan published Labour's Keith Vaz holds Leicester East in 2017 general election

author: Ciaranfagan
title: Ciaranfagan published Labour's Keith Vaz holds Leicester East in 2017 general election
text:
Labour's Keith Vaz holds Leicester East in 2017 general election By Ciaranfagan | Posted: June 09, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES 
Keith Vaz was returned as Labour MP for Leicester East with a crushing majority. 
His constituency's result were the last to be declared and rounded off an excellent night for Labour in Leicester. 
Mr Vaz's increased his share of the vote – as did his colleagues Liz Kendall and Jon Ashworth. 
Speaking after his victory, Mr Vaz said: "Jeremy Corbyn did a great job despite all the criticism." 
Read more: Full general election results in Leicester and Leicestershire 
Mr Vaz paid tribute to party colleagues on the city council, including elected mayor Sir Peter Soulsby for upholding Labour values in the city and helping to ensure tonight's successes. 
He added: "If Theresa May does not increase the number of seats for the Conservative Party then I think she would have to consider her position, as would any sitting Prime Minister." 
Mr Vaz added that the national result would also have a significant impact on the pending Brexit negotiations. 
The independent local candidate, Sujarta Barot, surprised many by claiming third place, ahead of the Green Party and Liberal Democrat candidates. How Leicester East voted in 2017 Sujata BAROT – Independent: 1,753 Nitesh DAVE - Liberal Democrats: 1,343 Ian FOX - Independent: 454 Edward YI HE – Conservative: 12,688 Keith VAZ - Labour: 35,116
